00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to the CN78XX Free Pool Allocator, a.k.a. FPA3
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 122227 $<hr>
00046  *
00047  */
00048 
00049 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00050 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx-fpa-defs.h>
00051 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx-scratch.h>
00052 #else
00053 #include "cvmx-fpa-defs.h"
00054 #include "cvmx-scratch.h"
00055 #endif
00056 
00057 #ifndef __CVMX_FPA3_H__
00058 #define __CVMX_FPA3_H__
00059 
00060 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00061 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00062 extern "C" {
00063 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00064 #endif
00065 
00066 typedef struct {
00067     unsigned res0:6;
00068     unsigned node:2;
00069     unsigned res1:2;
00070     unsigned lpool:6;
00071     unsigned valid_magic:16;
00072 } cvmx_fpa3_pool_t;
00073 
00074 typedef struct {
00075     unsigned res0:6;
00076     unsigned node:2;
00077     unsigned res1:6;
00078     unsigned laura:10;
00079     unsigned valid_magic:16;
00080 } cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t;
00081 
00082 #define CVMX_FPA3_VALID_MAGIC 0xf9a3
00083 #define CVMX_FPA3_INVALID_GAURA ((cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t){0, 0, 0, 0, 0})
00084 #define CVMX_FPA3_INVALID_POOL ((cvmx_fpa3_pool_t){0, 0, 0, 0, 0})
00085 
00086 static inline bool __cvmx_fpa3_aura_valid(cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t aura)
00087 {
00088     if (aura.valid_magic != CVMX_FPA3_VALID_MAGIC)
00089         return false;
00090     return true;
00091 }
00092 
00093 static inline bool __cvmx_fpa3_pool_valid(cvmx_fpa3_pool_t pool)
00094 {
00095     if (pool.valid_magic != CVMX_FPA3_VALID_MAGIC)
00096             return false;
00097     return true;
00098 }
00099 
00100 static inline cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t __cvmx_fpa3_gaura(int node, int laura)
00101 {
00102     cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t aura;
00103 
00104     if (node < 0)
00105         node = cvmx_get_node_num();
00106     if (laura < 0)
00107         return CVMX_FPA3_INVALID_GAURA;
00108 
00109     aura.node = node;
00110     aura.laura = laura;
00111     aura.valid_magic = CVMX_FPA3_VALID_MAGIC;
00112     return aura;
00113 }
00114 
00115 static inline cvmx_fpa3_pool_t __cvmx_fpa3_pool(int node, int lpool)
00116 {
00117     cvmx_fpa3_pool_t pool;
00118 
00119     if (node < 0)
00120         node = cvmx_get_node_num();
00121     if (lpool < 0)
00122         return CVMX_FPA3_INVALID_POOL;
00123 
00124     pool.node = node;
00125     pool.lpool = lpool;
00126     pool.valid_magic = CVMX_FPA3_VALID_MAGIC;
00127     return pool;
00128 }
00129 
00130 #undef CVMX_FPA3_VALID_MAGIC
00131 
00132 /**
00133  * Structure describing the data format used for stores to the FPA.
00134  */
00135 typedef union {
00136     uint64_t u64;
00137     struct {
00138         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t scraddr:8, /**
00139                      * the (64-bit word) location in
00140                      * scratchpad to write to (if len != 0)
00141                      */
00142         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t len:8,     /**
00143                      * the number of words in the response
00144                      * (0 => no response)
00145                      */
00146         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did:8,     /**
00147                      * the ID of the device on the
00148                      * non-coherent bus
00149                      */
00150         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t addr:40,   /**
00151                      * the address that will appear in the
00152                      * first tick on the NCB bus
00153                      */
00154         ))));
00155     } s;
00156     struct {
00157         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t scraddr:8,     /**
00158                      * the (64-bit word) location in
00159                      * scratchpad to write to (if len != 0)
00160                      */
00161         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t len:8,     /**
00162                      * length of return in workds, must be
00163                      * one.  If the pool has no availale pts
00164                      * in the selected pool then the ptr
00165                      * returned for the IOBDMA operation are
00166                      * 0s, indicating that the pool does not
00167                      * have an adequate number of ptrs to
00168                      * satisfy the IOBDMA.
00169                      */
00170         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did:8,     /**
00171                      * the ID of the device on the
00172                      * non-coherent bus
00173                      */
00174         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t node:4,    /** OCI node number */
00175         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t red:1,     /** Perform RED on allocation */
00176         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved2:9,   /** Reserved */
00177         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t aura:10,   /** Aura number */
00178         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved3:16,  /** Reserved */
00179         ))))))));
00180     } cn78xx;
00181 } cvmx_fpa3_iobdma_data_t;
00182 
00183 /**
00184  * Struct describing load allocate operation addresses for FPA pool.
00185  */
00186 union cvmx_fpa3_load_data {
00187     uint64_t u64;
00188     struct {
00189         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t seg:2,
00190         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved1:13,
00191         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t io:1,      /** Indicates I/O space */
00192         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did:8,     /**
00193                      * the ID of the device on the
00194                      * non-coherent bus
00195                      */
00196         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t node:4,    /** OCI node number */
00197         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t red:1,     /** Perform RED on allocation */
00198         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved2:9,   /** Reserved */
00199         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t aura:10,   /** Aura number */
00200         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved3:16,  /** Reserved */
00201         )))))))));
00202     };
00203 };
00204 typedef union cvmx_fpa3_load_data cvmx_fpa3_load_data_t;
00205 
00206 /**
00207  * Struct describing store free operation addresses from FPA pool.
00208  */
00209 union cvmx_fpa3_store_addr {
00210     uint64_t u64;
00211     struct {
00212         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t seg:2,
00213         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved1:13,
00214         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t io:1,      /** Indicates I/O space */
00215         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did:8,     /**
00216                      * the ID of the device on the
00217                      * non-coherent bus
00218                      */
00219         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t node:4,    /** OCI node number */
00220         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved2:10,  /** Reserved */
00221         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t aura:10,   /** Aura number */
00222         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t fabs:1,    /** free absolute */
00223         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved3:3,   /** Reserved */
00224         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t dwb_count:9,   /**
00225                      * Number of cache lines for which the
00226                      * hardware should try to execute
00227                      * 'don't-write-back' commands.
00228                      */
00229         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t reserved4:3,   /** Reserved */
00230         )))))))))));
00231     };
00232 };
00233 typedef union cvmx_fpa3_store_addr cvmx_fpa3_store_addr_t;
00234 
00235 enum cvmx_fpa3_pool_alignment_e {
00236     FPA_NATURAL_ALIGNMENT,
00237     FPA_OFFSET_ALIGNMENT,
00238     FPA_OPAQUE_ALIGNMENT
00239 };

00241 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL  //XXX temp for octeon3_ethernet.c
00242 # define CVMX_FPA3_NUM_POOLX                    64  // Depricated
00243 # define CVMX_FPA3_NUM_AURAS                     1024   // Depricated
00244 #endif
00245 
00246 #define CVMX_FPA3_AURAX_LIMIT_MAX               ((1ull<<40)-1)
00247 
00248 /**
00249  * @INTERNAL
00250  * Accessor functions to return number of POOLS in an FPA3
00251  * depending on SoC model.
00252  * The number is per-node for models supporting multi-node configurations.
00253  */
00254 static inline int cvmx_fpa3_num_pools(void)
00255 {
00256     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
00257         return 64;
00258     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX))
00259         return 32;
00260     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX))
00261         return 32;
00262     cvmx_printf("ERROR: %s: Unknowm model\n",__func__);
00263     return -1;
00264 }
00265 
00266 /**
00267  * @INTERNAL
00268  * Accessor functions to return number of AURAS in an FPA3
00269  * depending on SoC model.
00270  * The number is per-node for models supporting multi-node configurations.
00271  */
00272 static inline int cvmx_fpa3_num_auras(void)
00273 {
00274     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
00275         return 1024;
00276     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX))
00277         return 512;
00278     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX))
00279         return 512;
00280     cvmx_printf("ERROR: %s: Unknowm model\n",__func__);
00281     return -1;
00282 }
00283 
00284 
00285 /**
00286  * Get the FPA3 POOL underneath FPA3 AURA, containing all its buffers
00287  *
00288  */
00289 static inline cvmx_fpa3_pool_t
00290 cvmx_fpa3_aura_to_pool(cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t aura)
00291 {
00292     cvmx_fpa3_pool_t pool;
00293     cvmx_fpa_aurax_pool_t aurax_pool;
00294 
00295     if (CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING) {
00296         if (!__cvmx_fpa3_aura_valid(aura))
00297             return CVMX_FPA3_INVALID_POOL;
00298     }
00299 
00300     aurax_pool.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(aura.node,
00301         CVMX_FPA_AURAX_POOL(aura.laura));
00302 
00303     pool = __cvmx_fpa3_pool(aura.node, aurax_pool.s.pool);
00304     return pool;
00305 }
00306 
00307 /**
00308  * Get a new block from the FPA pool
00309  *
00310  * @param aura  - aura number
00311  * @return pointer to the block or NULL on failure
00312  */
00313 static inline void *cvmx_fpa3_alloc(cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t aura)
00314 {
00315     uint64_t address;
00316     cvmx_fpa3_load_data_t load_addr;
00317 
00318     if (CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING) {
00319         if (!__cvmx_fpa3_aura_valid(aura))
00320             return NULL;
00321     }
00322 
00323     load_addr.u64 = 0;
00324     load_addr.seg = CVMX_MIPS_SPACE_XKPHYS;
00325     load_addr.io = 1;
00326     load_addr.did = 0x29;    /* Device ID. Indicates FPA. */
00327     load_addr.node = aura.node;
00328     load_addr.red = 0;       /* Perform RED on allocation.
00329                   * FIXME to use config option
00330                   */
00331     load_addr.aura = aura.laura;
00332 
00333     address = cvmx_read64_uint64(load_addr.u64);
00334     if (!address)
00335         return NULL;
00336     return cvmx_phys_to_ptr(address);
00337 }
00338 
00339 /**
00340  * Asynchronously get a new block from the FPA
00341  *
00342  * The result of cvmx_fpa_async_alloc() may be retrieved using
00343  * cvmx_fpa_async_alloc_finish().
00344  *
00345  * @param scr_addr Local scratch address to put response in.  This is a byte
00346  *         address but must be 8 byte aligned.
00347  * @param aura     Global aura to get the block from
00348  */
00349 static inline void
00350 cvmx_fpa3_async_alloc(uint64_t scr_addr, cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t aura)
00351 {
00352     cvmx_fpa3_iobdma_data_t data;
00353 
00354     /* Hardware only uses 64 bit aligned locations, so convert from byte
00355      * address to 64-bit index
00356      */
00357     data.u64 = 0ull;
00358     data.cn78xx.scraddr = scr_addr >> 3;
00359     data.cn78xx.len = 1;
00360     data.cn78xx.did = 0x29;
00361     data.cn78xx.node = aura.node;
00362     data.cn78xx.aura = aura.laura;
00363     cvmx_scratch_write64(scr_addr, 0ull);
00364 
00365     CVMX_SYNCW;
00366     cvmx_send_single(data.u64);
00367 }
00368 
00369 /**
00370  * Retrieve the result of cvmx_fpa3_async_alloc
00371  *
00372  * @param scr_addr The Local scratch address.  Must be the same value
00373  * passed to cvmx_fpa_async_alloc().
00374  *
00375  * @param aura Global aura the block came from.  Must be the same value
00376  * passed to cvmx_fpa_async_alloc.
00377  *
00378  * @return Pointer to the block or NULL on failure
00379  */
00380 static inline void *
00381 cvmx_fpa3_async_alloc_finish(uint64_t scr_addr, cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t aura)
00382 {
00383     uint64_t address;
00384 
00385     CVMX_SYNCIOBDMA;
00386 
00387     address = cvmx_scratch_read64(scr_addr);
00388     if (cvmx_likely(address))
00389         return cvmx_phys_to_ptr(address);
00390     else
00391         /* Try regular alloc if async failed */
00392         return cvmx_fpa3_alloc(aura);
00393 }
00394 
00395 /**
00396  * Free a pointer back to the pool.
00397  *
00398  * @param aura   global aura number
00399  * @param ptr    physical address of block to free.
00400  * @param num_cache_lines Cache lines to invalidate
00401  */
00402 static inline void cvmx_fpa3_free(void *ptr, cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t aura,
00403                   unsigned int num_cache_lines)
00404 {
00405     cvmx_fpa3_store_addr_t newptr;
00406     cvmx_addr_t newdata;
00407 
00408     if (CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING) {
00409         if (!__cvmx_fpa3_aura_valid(aura))
00410             return;
00411     }
00412 
00413     newdata.u64 = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(ptr);
00414 
00415     /* Make sure that any previous writes to memory go out before we free
00416        this buffer. This also serves as a barrier to prevent GCC from
00417        reordering operations to after the free. */
00418     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00419 
00420     newptr.u64 = 0;
00421     newptr.seg = CVMX_MIPS_SPACE_XKPHYS;
00422     newptr.io = 1;
00423     newptr.did = 0x29;    /* Device id, indicates FPA */
00424     newptr.node = aura.node;
00425     newptr.aura = aura.laura;
00426     newptr.fabs = 0;    /* Free absolute. FIXME to use config option */
00427     newptr.dwb_count = num_cache_lines;
00428 
00429     cvmx_write_io(newptr.u64, newdata.u64);
00430 }
00431 
00432 /**
00433  * Free a pointer back to the pool without flushing the write buffer.
00434  *
00435  * @param aura   global aura number
00436  * @param ptr    physical address of block to free.
00437  * @param num_cache_lines Cache lines to invalidate
00438  */
00439 static inline void cvmx_fpa3_free_nosync(void *ptr, cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t aura,
00440                   unsigned int num_cache_lines)
00441 {
00442     cvmx_fpa3_store_addr_t newptr;
00443     cvmx_addr_t newdata;
00444 
00445     if (CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING) {
00446         if (!__cvmx_fpa3_aura_valid(aura))
00447             return;
00448     }
00449 
00450     newdata.u64 = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(ptr);
00451 
00452     /* Prevent GCC from reordering writes to (*ptr) */
00453     asm volatile ("" : : : "memory");
00454 
00455     newptr.u64 = 0;
00456     newptr.seg = CVMX_MIPS_SPACE_XKPHYS;
00457     newptr.io = 1;
00458     newptr.did = 0x29;    /* Device id, indicates FPA */
00459     newptr.node = aura.node;
00460     newptr.aura = aura.laura;
00461     newptr.fabs = 0;    /* Free absolute. FIXME to use config option */
00462     newptr.dwb_count = num_cache_lines;
00463 
00464     cvmx_write_io(newptr.u64, newdata.u64);
00465 }
00466 
00467 static inline int cvmx_fpa3_pool_is_enabled(cvmx_fpa3_pool_t pool)
00468 {
00469     cvmx_fpa_poolx_cfg_t pool_cfg;
00470     if (!__cvmx_fpa3_pool_valid(pool))
00471         return -1;
00472 
00473     pool_cfg.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(
00474         pool.node, CVMX_FPA_POOLX_CFG(pool.lpool));
00475     return pool_cfg.cn78xx.ena;
00476 }
00477 
00478 static inline int cvmx_fpa3_config_red_params(unsigned node, int qos_avg_en, 
00479                           int red_lvl_dly, int avg_dly)
00480 {
00481     cvmx_fpa_gen_cfg_t fpa_cfg;
00482     cvmx_fpa_red_delay_t red_delay;
00483 
00484     fpa_cfg.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, CVMX_FPA_GEN_CFG);
00485     fpa_cfg.s.avg_en = qos_avg_en;
00486     fpa_cfg.s.lvl_dly = red_lvl_dly;
00487     cvmx_write_csr_node(node, CVMX_FPA_GEN_CFG, fpa_cfg.u64);
00488 
00489     red_delay.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, CVMX_FPA_RED_DELAY);
00490     red_delay.s.avg_dly = avg_dly;
00491     cvmx_write_csr_node(node, CVMX_FPA_RED_DELAY, red_delay.u64);
00492     return 0;
00493 }
00494 
00495 
00496 /**
00497  * Gets the buffer size of the specified pool,
00498  *
00499  * @param aura Global aura number
00500  * @return Returns size of the buffers in the specified pool.
00501  */
00502 static inline int cvmx_fpa3_get_aura_buf_size(cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t aura)
00503 {
00504     cvmx_fpa3_pool_t pool;
00505     cvmx_fpa_poolx_cfg_t pool_cfg;
00506     int block_size;
00507 
00508     pool = cvmx_fpa3_aura_to_pool(aura);
00509 
00510     if (CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING) {
00511         if (!__cvmx_fpa3_pool_valid(pool))
00512             return -1;
00513     }
00514     pool_cfg.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(pool.node,
00515         CVMX_FPA_POOLX_CFG(pool.lpool));
00516     block_size = pool_cfg.cn78xx.buf_size << 7;
00517     return block_size;
00518 }
00519 
00520 /**
00521  * Return the number of available buffers in an AURA
00522  *
00523  * @param aura to receive count for
00524  * @return available buffer count
00525  */
00526 static inline long long cvmx_fpa3_get_available(cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t aura)
00527 {
00528     cvmx_fpa3_pool_t pool;
00529     cvmx_fpa_poolx_available_t avail_reg;
00530     cvmx_fpa_aurax_cnt_t cnt_reg;
00531     cvmx_fpa_aurax_cnt_limit_t limit_reg;
00532     long long ret;
00533 
00534     pool = cvmx_fpa3_aura_to_pool(aura);
00535 
00536     if (CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING) {
00537         if (!__cvmx_fpa3_pool_valid(pool))
00538             return -1LL;
00539     }
00540 
00541     /* Get POOL available buffer count */
00542     avail_reg.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(pool.node,
00543         CVMX_FPA_POOLX_AVAILABLE(pool.lpool));
00544 
00545     /* Get AURA current available count */
00546     cnt_reg.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(aura.node,
00547         CVMX_FPA_AURAX_CNT(aura.laura));
00548     limit_reg.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(aura.node,
00549         CVMX_FPA_AURAX_CNT_LIMIT(aura.laura));
00550 
00551     if (limit_reg.cn78xx.limit < cnt_reg.cn78xx.cnt) return 0;
00552 
00553     /* Calculate AURA-based buffer allowance */
00554     ret = limit_reg.cn78xx.limit -
00555         cnt_reg.cn78xx.cnt;
00556 
00557     /* Use POOL real buffer availability when less then allowance */
00558     if (ret > (long long) avail_reg.cn78xx.count)
00559         ret = avail_reg.cn78xx.count;
00560 
00561     return ret;
00562 }
00563 
00564 /**
00565  * Configure the QoS parameters of an FPA3 AURA
00566  *
00567  * @param aura is the FPA3 AURA handle
00568  * @param ena_bp enables backpressure when outstanding count exceeds 'bp_thresh'
00569  * @param ena_red enables random early discard when outstanding count exceeds 'pass_thresh'
00570  * @param pass_thresh is the maximum count to invoke flow control
00571  * @param drop_thresh is the count threshold to begin dropping packets
00572  * @param bp_thresh is the back-pressure threshold
00573  *
00574  */
00575 static inline void cvmx_fpa3_setup_aura_qos(cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t aura, bool ena_red,
00576     uint64_t pass_thresh, uint64_t drop_thresh,
00577     bool ena_bp, uint64_t bp_thresh)
00578 {
00579     unsigned shift = 0;
00580     uint64_t shift_thresh;
00581     cvmx_fpa_aurax_cnt_limit_t limit_reg;
00582     cvmx_fpa_aurax_cnt_levels_t aura_level;
00583 
00584     if (!__cvmx_fpa3_aura_valid(aura))
00585         return;
00586 
00587     /* Get AURAX count limit for validation */
00588     limit_reg.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(aura.node,
00589         CVMX_FPA_AURAX_CNT_LIMIT(aura.laura));
00590 
00591     if (pass_thresh < 256)
00592         pass_thresh = 255;
00593 
00594     if (drop_thresh <= pass_thresh || drop_thresh > limit_reg.cn78xx.limit)
00595         drop_thresh = limit_reg.cn78xx.limit;
00596 
00597     if (bp_thresh < 256 || bp_thresh > limit_reg.cn78xx.limit)
00598         bp_thresh = limit_reg.cn78xx.limit >> 1;
00599 
00600     shift_thresh = (bp_thresh > drop_thresh) ? bp_thresh : drop_thresh;
00601 
00602     /* Calculate shift so that the largest threshold fits in 8 bits */
00603     for (shift = 0; shift < (1 << 6); shift++) {
00604         if (0 == ((shift_thresh >> shift) & ~0xffull))
00605             break;
00606     };
00607 
00608     aura_level.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(aura.node,
00609                     CVMX_FPA_AURAX_CNT_LEVELS(aura.laura));
00610     aura_level.s.pass = pass_thresh >> shift;
00611     aura_level.s.drop = drop_thresh >> shift;
00612     aura_level.s.bp = bp_thresh >> shift;
00613     aura_level.s.shift = shift;
00614     aura_level.s.red_ena = ena_red;
00615     aura_level.s.bp_ena = ena_bp;
00616     cvmx_write_csr_node(aura.node, CVMX_FPA_AURAX_CNT_LEVELS(aura.laura),
00617                 aura_level.u64);
00618 }
00619 
00620 extern cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t cvmx_fpa3_reserve_aura(int node, int desired_aura_num);
00621 extern int cvmx_fpa3_release_aura(cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t aura);
00622 extern cvmx_fpa3_pool_t cvmx_fpa3_reserve_pool(int node, int desired_pool_num);
00623 extern int cvmx_fpa3_release_pool(cvmx_fpa3_pool_t pool);
00624 extern int cvmx_fpa3_is_aura_available(int node, int aura_num);
00625 extern int cvmx_fpa3_is_pool_available(int node, int pool_num);

00627 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL

00629     int node, int desired_pool, const char *name,
00630     unsigned block_size, unsigned num_blocks, void *buffer);

00636  * @param pool - configured pool to attach aura to
00637  * @param desired_aura - pointer to aura to use, set to -1 to allocate

00639  * @param block_size - size of buffers to use
00640  * @param num_blocks - number of blocks to allocate
00641  *
00642  * @return configured gaura on success, CVMX_FPA3_INVALID_GAURA on failure
00643  */
00644 extern cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t cvmx_fpa3_set_aura_for_pool
00645     (cvmx_fpa3_pool_t pool, int desired_aura,
00646     const char *name, unsigned block_size, unsigned num_blocks);

00651  *

00653  * @param desired_aura - aura to use, -1 for dynamic allocation
00654  * @param name - name to register
00655  * @param block_size - size of buffers in pool
00656  * @param num_blocks - max number of buffers allowed
00657  */
00658 extern cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t cvmx_fpa3_setup_aura_and_pool(
00659         int node, int desired_aura,

00669 
00670 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_UBOOT
00671 /* FIXME: Need a different macro for stage2 of u-boot */
00672 
00673 static inline void
00674 cvmx_fpa3_stage2_init(int aura, int pool, uint64_t stack_paddr, int stacklen,
00675             int buffer_sz, int buf_cnt)
00676 {
00677     cvmx_fpa_poolx_cfg_t pool_cfg;
00678 
00679     /* Configure pool stack */
00680     cvmx_write_csr_node(0, CVMX_FPA_POOLX_STACK_BASE(pool), stack_paddr);
00681     cvmx_write_csr_node(0, CVMX_FPA_POOLX_STACK_ADDR(pool), stack_paddr);
00682     cvmx_write_csr_node(0, CVMX_FPA_POOLX_STACK_END(pool),
00683         stack_paddr + stacklen);
00684 
00685     /* Configure pool with buffer size */
00686     pool_cfg.u64 = 0;
00687     pool_cfg.cn78xx.nat_align = 1;
00688     pool_cfg.cn78xx.buf_size = buffer_sz >> 7;
00689     pool_cfg.cn78xx.l_type = 0x2;
00690     pool_cfg.cn78xx.ena = 0;
00691     cvmx_write_csr_node(0, CVMX_FPA_POOLX_CFG(pool), pool_cfg.u64);
00692     /* Reset pool before starting */
00693     pool_cfg.cn78xx.ena = 1;
00694     cvmx_write_csr_node(0, CVMX_FPA_POOLX_CFG(pool), pool_cfg.u64);
00695 
00696     cvmx_write_csr_node(0, CVMX_FPA_AURAX_CFG(aura), 0);
00697     cvmx_write_csr_node(0, CVMX_FPA_AURAX_CNT_ADD(aura), buf_cnt);
00698     cvmx_write_csr_node(0, CVMX_FPA_AURAX_POOL(aura), (uint64_t) pool);
00699 }
00700 
00701 static inline void
00702 cvmx_fpa3_stage2_disable(int aura, int pool)
00703 {
00704     cvmx_write_csr_node(0, CVMX_FPA_AURAX_POOL(aura), 0);
00705     cvmx_write_csr_node(0, CVMX_FPA_POOLX_CFG(pool), 0);
00706     cvmx_write_csr_node(0, CVMX_FPA_POOLX_STACK_BASE(pool), 0);
00707     cvmx_write_csr_node(0, CVMX_FPA_POOLX_STACK_ADDR(pool), 0);
00708     cvmx_write_csr_node(0, CVMX_FPA_POOLX_STACK_END(pool), 0);
00709 }
00710 #endif /* CVMX_BUILD_FOR_UBOOT */
00711 #endif  /* !CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL */

00715 }
